creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription: Ahikaga Motouji, a son of Takauji, the younger brother of Yoshiakira, moved to Kamakura in order to take control of the eatern Japan and help his father take over the whole country. With his excellent leadership, his army succefully eliminated the opponents of Ashikaga regime from the eastern Japan
portfolio: From One Hundred Generals of Japan
title: No.47 Ashikaga Motouji
